content.description: Climb slopey crimps up and slightly left.  An easier exit exists if you traverse to the shelf in the middle.
content.location: North side of the river about 100yds from the Druid boulder.  If you are standing at the Druid boulder walk towards the hillside and you will see it.

content.description: Scrambling is a route that starts out with a few hard, cruxy moves that give it its V2 rating, ending with a mantle. Then, like its name, turns into an 8 foot or so 3-4th class scramble up the rock.
content.location: About 15 yards up-river from Eye of the Bunholder
Across river from Lizard Dome. Climbs further up river than Orange Blossom are in the Hoight's Crossing area.

content.description: I found this route when visiting the Yuba River to climb. Soon after, I found a picture of this route on the South Yuba River page. I'm not sure if this route already has a rating or not, so I'm giving it a rating of V1. Start by reaching/jumping up to a crack that you can easily hold on to. There are some good footholds to assist you. Then, reach up to a ledge where you can pull yourself up to reach the top. After you got your foot onto the ledge, the top-out is easy. First Ascent unknown.
content.location: Between The Flake and the Vices Boulder (American Spirits).

content.description: Start on the flake, climb straight up.
content.location: After crossing first small wooden bridge, head down and stay left.

content.description: Fun opening moves, reach up to diagonal crack, head up and right into corner.
Big move to nice jug, mantle.
content.location: After the first descending wooden staircase from the trailhead, take the next path down to the river. Once you get down, you will be able to find Bold Hold down the river a bit.

content.description: Technical stemming up the corner. Bad fall into water.
content.location: 50 yards up river from Eye of the Beholder.

content.description: start in deepish water, start on slopers to a beached whale mantle, then climb left onto a ledge. Climb right leaning crack on jugs into a cool handjam sequence then exit out on jugs to a scary topout. Theres poison oak at the top of the crack, which i will be removing soon. super easy, scary fun climb.
content.protection: Deep water start, safe for about the first 10-15 feet of crack, with a committing topout high above submerged rocks
content.location: 20 feet to the left of circle of trust, perfect dihedral going up acid rock, a popular river jump spot.
